Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='MGBFSMAL01')

BibliographicData.Title: Eye-hand Coordination during Reaching. I. Anatomical Relationships between Parietal and Frontal Cortex

BrainSite.FullName: mesial part of area 7; area PGm
Caudal cingulate motor area, dorsal bank
Caudal cingulate motor area, ventral bank
Agranular frontal area 1 (= primary motor area)
Agranular frontal area 2 (= caudal dorsolateral premotor area)
area F2 around the pre-central dimple
Agranular frontal area 4 (= caudal ventrolateral premotor area)
Agranular frontal area 5 (= rostral ventrolateral premotor area)
Agranular frontal area 7 (= rostral dorsolateral premotor area)
Upper bank of the intraparietal sulcus
caudal part of parietal area PEc, area 5 (part)
rostral part of parietal area PEc, area 5 (part)

Animals.Comments: Three animals were used in the study, but it is not sure which one is used in a specific case.

Reference.Quotation: "In the first, one single tracer was injected throughout the entire extent of PEc (Table 1, case ME)." p. 514
"In the second case (Table 1, case BO), two different tracers were injected (Fig. 4), one (FB) in the rostral, the other (DY) in the caudal part of PEc." p. 516
"In the second animal (Table 1, case ME), the cores and halos were all lateral and close to pre-CD (Fig. 3)." pp. 516-517
"In one animal (Table 1, case NI), the cores and halos of diffusion of FB were all contained within F2 (Fig. 2), mostly in its peri-arcuate part, ... ." p. 516

Animals.Comments: Three anlmals were used in the hole experiment, but it is not sure, which one is used in a special case.

Reference.Quotation: "In the second case (Table 1, case BO), two different tracers were injected (Fig. 4), one (FB) in the rostral, the other (DY) in the caudal part of PEc." p. 516
